title: Changing look and feel messes with macOS integrations
body:
**Describe the bug** When you change the Display setting in the ZAP (Weekly) Setting, like choosing MacOS specific UI overrides (like the native menu bar) doesn't appear anymore. Also instead of showing up as ZAP in the Dock it shows up as Java. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Download ZAP Weekly on MacOS (Catalina, 10.15.5 (19F101)) 2. Go to `Preferences -> Display` 3. Change anything (e.g. set theme to Flat Dark) 4. Shut down Zap 5. Restart Zap 6. ZAP now shows the integrated windows and linux style menu bar, shows java logo instead of the zap logo **Expected behavior** Menu Bar renders nativly and App Icon shows correctly. (See initial screenshot) **Screenshots** ZAP First Start (Expected behavior) ZAP After tweaking the Display settings: **Software versions** - ZAP: `ZAP_WEEKLY_D-2020-06-08` - Add-on: - - OS: [e.g. Windows 10] - Java: [e.g. openjdk 11.0.7 2020-04-14] - Browser: - **Errors from the zap.log file**
Logs of the First Start! ```txt Found Java version 11.0.7 Available memory: 16384 MB Using JVM args: -Xmx4096m 430 [main] INFO org.zaproxy.zap.GuiBootstrap - OWASP ZAP D-2020-06-08 started 12/06/2020, 17:52:54 with home /Users/jannikhollenbach/Library/Application Support/ZAP_D/ 963 [AWT-EventQueue-0] INFO org.parosproxy.paros.network.SSLConnector -
